<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of answer_to_connection:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
answer_to_connection (void *cls,
                      struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                      const char *url,
                      const char *method,
                      const char *version,
                      const char *upload_data,
                      size_t *upload_data_size,
                      void **req_cls)
{
  const char *page = "<html><body>Hello timeout!</body></html>";
  struct MHD_Response *response;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  (void) cls;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) url;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) version;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) method;            /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data_size;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) req_cls;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  response = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (page),
                                                     (const void *) page);
  if (MHD_YES !=
      MHD_add_response_header (response,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE,
                               "text/html"))
  {
    fprintf (stderr,
             "Failed to set content type header!\n");
  }
  ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                            MHD_HTTP_OK,
                            response);
  MHD_destroy_response (response);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_add_response_header (response, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE, "text/html")
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call shown is to an external function MHD_add_response_header from inside answer_to_connection. This, by itself, does not call answer_to_connection and therefore does not constitute direct or indirect recursion. The rule would only be violated if MHD_add_response_header (or something it calls) ended up calling answer_to_connection (creating a cycle), or if MHD_add_response_header were a macro that expanded to call answer_to_connection. No evidence of such behavior is present in the fragment, so the rule is not violated.
